as a large building in Australia has turned off its lights
on Earth Day like every year.
These buildings turned off their lights for 1 hour
at 8:30 p.m. on the evening of March 23.
To celebrate Earth Hour, the lights
of Australia's iconic Sydney Opera House
simultaneously turned off the lights of the
Sydney Bridge and other buildings.  Other buildings across the
city, along with 2.2 million people in
this country, turned off their lights at exactly 8:30

International Organization for Conservation of Nature

US President Joe Biden signed into law a
1,200 billion USD budget to maintain the operation
of the US government until September of this year.
Ending the risk of a partial shutdown of the
US government, the White House said Mr. Biden signed
the bill at his home in Wilmington,
Delaware, where he spent the previous weekend
in the early morning of March 23. The Senate,
dominated by the Democratic Party, signed the bill.  promoted
voting and passed with 74 votes for
and 24 votes against. In the House of Representatives,
this law was also passed with 286
votes in favor and 134 votes against the 102-page law
providing 886 billion dollars to the Ministry of
Defense.  including salary increases
for the US military. However, it does not
include military aid to many
